Citations

  • Course content was adapted to this Data Science course from UIUC’s STAT 107 Fall 2019 and Spring 2020 that was developed and taught by Karle Flanagan and Wade Fagen-Ulmschneider.

  • Images are credited to the following:

    • Landing Page Photo: Calendar photo created by rawpixel.com - www.freepik.com
    • Default Picture for Announcement Cards: Business photo created by rawpixel.com - www.freepik.com
    • Statistics Textbook Background Photo by Photographer Shad Anderson.

Digital Scholars Data Science is an introduction to topics that intersect between statistics, computation, and real-world applications. This 5-week-long course will be project-driven, which will give students opportunities to analyze real-world datasets and discover the impact of the data. Students will gain an understanding of complex ideas in statistics and computing, and consider the social impact and issues of Data Science such as privacy and design.
